We Brew Beer!

We make beers from fresh ingredients brewed from the simplest ingredients without presarvites. Malt, hops, water and yeast it´s all it takes.

Malt

We use malt which we mill ourselves. We have control of the milling so it is not to coarse.

Hops

Fresh hops are the key to brewing good beer. All of our hops ar vacuum sealed and kept in a freezer for mazimum freshness.

Water

Icelandic water is great for brewing beer although it can lack in minerals for New England IPA.

Yeast

The yeast we use is a liquid yeast which is a pain to handle but the quality of liquid yeast is far superior than dry yeast.

Our Brewing Process

Our process is simple when it comes to brewing our beer. Anybody can do it.

1

Creating The Recipe

When creating the recipe it´s best to use a software called Brewfather to design the recipe. If you are new to brewing beer we recommend that you take online courses to learn that process.

2

Brewing The Recipe

We brew our beer on a 2 tier kettle system. One is for boiling and the other on is for mashing. We use the 10 gallon BrewEasy which is controlled by a Raspberry Pi with a Python software which keeps the temps steady in the mashing process.

3

Fermentation

After the beer has been brewed he is cooled down to 20 degreec celsius and the yeast is pitched in. The fermentation takes about 10 days with ipa, pale ale and such beers but for high gravity beers like imperial stouts can take up to 6 months.

4

Enjoying

After fermentation the beer goes into kegs and is flushed with co2. Carbonation has to build up and that takes 7-10 days. Remember to enjoy responsibly.
